def.dt: :an act or process of electing the election of a new governor
:the fact of being elected her election to the Senate
:the right, power, or privilege of making a choice
:a day legally established for the election of public officials
:the first Tuesday after the first Monday in November in an even year designated for national elections in the United States and observed as a legal holiday in many states
:a special election held between regular elections in order to fill a vacancy
:an election usually held at regular intervals in which candidates are elected in all or most constituencies of a nation or state
